heroDescription: Miami, a vibrant coastal city, is known for its diverse culture, tourism, and finance sectors.
landscapeDescription: Miami's economy thrives on tourism, finance, and international trade. The city is a gateway to Latin America, enhancing its global business appeal.
uniqueNeeds: Miami requires a focus on disaster preparedness, affordable housing, and economic diversification to sustain growth.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Miami's tourism-heavy economy faces risks from hurricanes and flooding. Real estate prices are volatile; diversify investments and consider climate resilience.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Miami's economy grew by 4.2%, driven by tourism and finance, despite global economic challenges.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Miami is $55,000, reflecting a diverse economic landscape with significant income disparity.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Miami are increasingly focusing on real estate and investment strategies tailored to local market conditions.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Miami's cost of living is rising, particularly in housing and transportation, impacting affordability for residents.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Miami's real estate market remains competitive, with home prices increasing by 8% year-over-year, raising affordability concerns.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Miami's business climate is improving, attracting startups and tech firms, but faces challenges in workforce development.
